stratego.server

Class DBManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • stratego.server.DBManager

  • public final class DBManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The DB manager class contains variables and methods for database queries and interactions.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DBManager() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.sql.Connection getConnection()
      Gets the database connection info.
      static java.lang.String getFriends(java.lang.String uname)
      this runs a query to return the name and online status of every user that has a friend relationship with the current user.
      static boolean login(java.lang.String uname, java.lang.String password)
      This runs a query to see if the submitted username and password match a user in the users table.
      static boolean logout(java.lang.String username)
      changes the online status of the user to false in the user table
      static java.lang.String requestFriend(java.lang.String user, java.lang.String friend)
      this makes a request that will create a new row in the friend table with the user's id as the first element and the friends id as the second and the accepted value as false
      static boolean signup(java.lang.String uname, java.lang.String password)
      This method runs a query that adds a new user to the users table.

      • signup

        public static boolean signup(java.lang.String uname,
                             java.lang.String password)
        This method runs a query that adds a new user to the users table.
        Parameters:
        uname - the new user
        password - the desired password
        Returns:
        Boolean True or false based on whether the name is available.

      • login

        public static boolean login(java.lang.String uname,
                            java.lang.String password)
        This runs a query to see if the submitted username and password match a user in the users table.
        Parameters:
        uname - the submitted username
        password - the submitted password
        Returns:
        Boolean True or false based on whether the username and password match a user from the table.

      • getFriends

        public static java.lang.String getFriends(java.lang.String uname)
        this runs a query to return the name and online status of every user that has a friend relationship with the current user. if the request as not been accepted then the second value should be request instead of online status
        Parameters:
        uname - the current user
        Returns:
        String[][] this should be a x by 2 array where x is the number of friends

      • requestFriend

        public static java.lang.String requestFriend(java.lang.String user,
                                             java.lang.String friend)
        this makes a request that will create a new row in the friend table with the user's id as the first element and the friends id as the second and the accepted value as false
        Parameters:
        user - [description]
        friend - [description]
        Returns:
        [description]

        [description]
